title: Man who killed banker Oliver Dearlove found not guilty of murder | Metro News
text:
Toby Meyjes for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 5:49 pm Oliver Dearlove died after being struck by a single punch (Picture: PA) 
A man who killed a banker with a single punch in an unprovoked attack has been found not guilty of murder. 
Trevor Timon, 31, delivered a ‘powerful’ left hook to Oliver Dearlove’s head, knocking him unconscious. Man hammered nail into dog's skull before burying it alive 
But the defendant denied intending to seriously hurt the 30-year-old and said he was just ‘pissed off’ at one of his friends for making a racist comment. 
The jobless plasterer, of Plumstead, south-east London, admitted manslaughter and was today cleared of murder after a jury deliberated for three hours. 
The victim’s mother Joy Wright and girlfriend Claire Wheatley sat in court hroughout the Old Bailey trial supported by other family members. Trevor Timon has been found not guilty of murder (Picture: Central News) 
Oliver, of New Eltham, who worked as a relationship manager at Duncan Lawrie Private Bank, had bene eating and drinking in Blackheath last August. 
At about half past midnight, they walked past Mordens nightclub where Timon had bought champagne for a group of women at a birthday party. 
Timon and the women walked along Tranquil Vale to get a cab home when they came across Oliver and two friends. 
The court heard different accounts from Timon, the four women and the banker’s friends on how the violence erupted. Oliver Dearlove’s girlfriend Claire Wheatley arrives at the Old Bailey (Picture: PA) 
One of the women claimed Oliver was ‘polite’ while admiring her baby pictures, while the victim’s friend Andrew Cook said Timon as angry and came out of nowhere ‘looking for a fight’. 
Giving evidence, Timon admitted telling the victim ‘if you don’t get out of my face I will knock you out’ but said it was just a ‘figure of speech’. 
The defendant, who is mixed race, said he was upset when one of the victim’s friends laughed and called him a ‘half chap’. 
Timon will be sentenced at the Old Bailey on Friday. More
